intro: Uncaria cordata f. sundaica, commonly known as the Sunda climbing tea. This variant is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions such as Borneo and Sumatra. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers, followed by red berries that are often used in traditional medicine.
